summary_statistics.assessment: BATCH IS GOOD QUALITY - Derrida text extraction maintains semantic integrity throughout. Ligature markers (fb01, fb02, fb00) are Unicode encoding artifacts, not OCR errors. Fragments appear to be line-break artifacts from complex philosophical terminology and multi-language quotations. No systematic corruption of names, key concepts, or philosophical vocabulary. All three MARGINAL pages remain semantically recoverable with full context.

notes_on_special_artifacts: Unicode ligature markers (fb01 for 'fi', fb02 for 'fl', fb00 for 'ff') appear throughout - these are legitimate typography from source PDF, not OCR errors
Footnote markers genuinely absent from this batch - no evidence of merged footnote superscripts with words
Foreign language handling: French accents generally preserved (écriture, différence, Jabès, etc.). German terms intact (Dasein, Aufhebung, etc.)
Fragments (criture, signi, speci, nal, tate, etc.) appear to be OCR line-break artifacts rather than systematic corruption - context and surrounding text enable recovery
Philosophical terminology highly accurate despite declared error rates - indicates errors are primarily in fragments and ligatures, not semantic corruption
No evidence of names being corrupted (Derrida, Rousset, Corneille, Husserl, Levinas, Heidegger all correct)
Key philosophical concepts fully preserved throughout batch: Being, difference, presence, deconstruction, structure, phenomenology, etc.
